title: How to Make a Loaf of White Bread

steps.headline: Spray the loaf pan with nonstick cooking spray.
Heat a small bowl by pouring in hot water and then tip out the water.
Add the yeast.
Add about 1 cup of warm water (105 to 110 degrees F or 38º C) to the yeast.
Let it rest until bubbly.
steps.description: This should take about 10 minutes. The mixture will strongly smell of yeast and look foamy when ready-to-use.

steps.headline: Add the yeast to a large mixing bowl.
Melt the butter and add it along with milk, sugar and salt into the yeast mixture.
Add 2 cups of flour and stir well.
steps.description: You can use an electric mixer, or a whisk. As shown in the image

steps.headline: Add the remaining flour, 1/4 cup at a time, until the dough is slightly sticky.
steps.description: The dough will start to not stick to the sides of the bowl.

steps.headline: Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface.
Knead for 10 minutes by hand.
steps.description: To knead by hand, place the heel of the palm and press the bread dough, turn 1/4 turn, repeat. See How to Knead Dough.

steps.headline: Shape dough into a ball.
Spray a clean mixing bowl with nonstick cooking spray.
Add the ball of dough to the mixing bowl.
steps.description: Turn to coat with nonstick cooking spray.

steps.headline: Cover with the tea towel.
Let it rise until double, for about 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
Remove the dough from the bowl.
Roll out using a rolling pin.
Shape into a loaf.
Place it into the loaf pan.
Let it rise until almost double, for about 1 hour.
Bake at 400º F or 200º C for about 30 minutes.
Take out the bread and let it cool.
The bread is ready .

text: Spray the loaf pan with nonstick cooking spray.  Heat a small bowl by pouring in hot water and then tip out the water.  Add the yeast.  Add about 1 cup of warm water (105 to 110 degrees F or 38º C) to the yeast.  Let it rest until bubbly. This should take about 10 minutes. The mixture will strongly smell of yeast and look foamy when ready-to-use. Add the yeast to a large mixing bowl.  Melt the butter and add it along with milk, sugar and salt into the yeast mixture.  Add 2 cups of flour and stir well. You can use an electric mixer, or a whisk. As shown in the image Add the remaining flour, 1/4 cup at a time, until the dough is slightly sticky. The dough will start to not stick to the sides of the bowl. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface.  Knead for 10 minutes by hand. To knead by hand, place the heel of the palm and press the bread dough, turn 1/4 turn, repeat. See How to Knead Dough. Shape dough into a ball.  Spray a clean mixing bowl with nonstick cooking spray.  Add the ball of dough to the mixing bowl. Turn to coat with nonstick cooking spray. Cover with the tea towel.  Let it rise until double, for about 1 to 1 1/2 hours.  Remove the dough from the bowl.  Roll out using a rolling pin.  Shape into a loaf.  Place it into the loaf pan.  Let it rise until almost double, for about 1 hour.  Bake at 400º F or 200º C for about 30 minutes.  Take out the bread and let it cool.  The bread is ready .
sentences: Spray the loaf pan with nonstick cooking spray.
Heat a small bowl by pouring in hot water and then tip out the water.
Add the yeast.
Add about 1 cup of warm water (105 to 110 degrees F or 38º C) to the yeast.
Let it rest until bubbly.
This should take about 10 minutes.
The mixture will strongly smell of yeast and look foamy when ready-to-use.
Add the yeast to a large mixing bowl.
Melt the butter and add it along with milk, sugar and salt into the yeast mixture.
Add 2 cups of flour and stir well.
You can use an electric mixer, or a whisk.
As shown in the image Add the remaining flour, 1/4 cup at a time, until the dough is slightly sticky.
The dough will start to not stick to the sides of the bowl.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface.
Knead for 10 minutes by hand.
To knead by hand, place the heel of the palm and press the bread dough, turn 1/4 turn, repeat.
See How to Knead Dough.
Shape dough into a ball.
Spray a clean mixing bowl with nonstick cooking spray.
Add the ball of dough to the mixing bowl.
Turn to coat with nonstick cooking spray.
Cover with the tea towel.
Let it rise until double, for about 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
Remove the dough from the bowl.
Roll out using a rolling pin.
Shape into a loaf.
Place it into the loaf pan.
Let it rise until almost double, for about 1 hour.
Bake at 400º F or 200º C for about 30 minutes.
Take out the bread and let it cool.
The bread is ready .
tyn_section: Stand mixer with a dough hook (optional)
